anemia: A condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen to your tissues.
hypertension: High blood pressure, a condition where the force of the blood against artery walls is too high.
diabetes: A disease that occurs when your blood glucose is too high.
asthma: A condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.
arthritis: Inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness.
osteoporosis: A condition that weakens bones, making them fragile and more likely to break.
dehydration: A harmful reduction in the amount of water in the body.
migraine: A severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light.
infection: The invasion and multiplication of microorganisms in body tissues, which may cause illness.
insomnia: Difficulty falling or staying asleep, even when a person has the chance to do so.
